Author: mole99
Content: That's right. From the first round of DRC with GF, it seems the whole rule deck is checked, including recommended rules.

Author: 246tnt
Content: Do they allow to waive the recommended ?

Author: mole99
Content: Yes. But it's going to be a back and forth.

Author: mole99
Content: In other words, if we don't have any DRC violations, we don't need a waiver file, and submitting to the foundry would be faster and less complicated.

Author: 246tnt
Content: Does the klayout deck test for recommended rules ?

Author: mole99
Content:
The ones that were violated weren't checked at least. I would need to go through the whole deck to see which are implemented and which are not.
The other way is to go backwards: see which DRC rules are triggered and trying to fix them/add them to the deck.
With actual designs in the reticle we should see a more complete list of DRC violations that are not yet caught by the open source rule decks.
